docs.text: as we see the terrible events that unfold before our eyes in the middle east at the moment , hollywood doesn't loose the oppertunity to get involved , by telling stories and expressing opinions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this film centers on a relationship forged throughout the adult lifetimes of two marine colonels , hays hodges ( tommy lee jones ) and terry childers ( samuel l . jackson ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they fought side by side in vietnam , where childers saved hodges' life by shooting an unarmed pow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's against the rules of war but understandable , in this story anyway , under the specific circumstances .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: certainly hodges is not complaining .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: years pass .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hodges , whose wounds make him unfit for action , gets a law degree and becomes a marine lawyer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: childers , is now a respected and much-decorated hero that has served his country with his life and sould .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: because of his excellent record , childers is sent to yemen to rescue the american ambassador ( ben kingsley ) , cowering in the embassy under assault from violent demonstrators and snipers blasting from rooftops .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: childers does what he has to do : evacuate the family and protect the men under his command .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after three marines die and the colonel thinks he sees ground fire , he orders his troops to shoot into the firing crowd .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: more than 80 yemeni men , women , and children are mowed down .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: childers is immediately accused of ordering his men to fire on a crowd and murder of unarmed civilians .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he persuades his old friend hodges to represent him in the courtroom drama that occupies the second half of the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: did childers violate authorized u . s . military rules of engagement ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or are there simply no rules in war ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the answers to these stereotypical questions are obvious , but the inconsistent plot immediately raises all sorts of other questions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the murder of 83 " innocent civilians " has to result into something greater than a simple trial in the u . s . where is the accusations from the arab leaders ?

docs.text: where is the u . n . ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film ends without even telling the most interesting story : what happens on the international arena ?

docs.text: this film ( in a way akin to films such as " a few good men " ) has already been accused of breaking the rules of morality and ethics and even of racism .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these accusations are pretty heavy , but also unfair .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what director william friedklin truly broke was the rules of decent filmmaking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one of the earliest apparent problems with 'rules of engagement' is its lack of credibility .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the entire operation in yemen may remind us about what happens in the middle east right now , but is overdone , contrived and unrealistic - as if a chain of events had to happen in a particular manner in order for the plot to proceed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a lot of it is so cheesy that no one could possibly accept it as reality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that is precisely why it's not offensive .

docs.text: it is completely unobjective .

docs.label: negative

docs.text: a lot of parallels are referring to nothing .

docs.text: it consists of countless stories , but not a definable plot .

docs.text: it tries to be everything for everyone and ends up being nothing for no one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think that it is ironic , because director william friedkin's probably most acclaimed film was " the exorcist " which had a silly story , but became a rather effective film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in this case you have a strong story with many possibilities and the result is a silly film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though several scenes bare the mark of professionalism ( such as the impressive battle scenes ) , his latest film does simply not engage .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i believe that friedklin is a director that is absolutely depended on great scripts and talented producers in order to succeed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's obvious that he has neither and the result is therefore a catastrophe .

docs.text: the characters feel designed , unreal , merely shadows , with no life outside the conflict .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even the actors can not save this film from going under .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though both jackson and jones act admirably , with performances that are as good as you get with a script like this , it is not something that these great actors can boast of .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they have roles that they could play blindfolded with their hand on the back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jackson is gray and jones uninteresting .

docs.text: on the charges of complete lack of objectivity , i find this film guilty .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: on the charges of breaking the rules of reasonable filmmaking , i find it guilty .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but on the charges of racism i find this film not guilty , because of it's inconclusive and often silly plot that lacks objectivity everywhere , not only when concerning the arab population .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i must admit that the film is dangerously near the line of being racially offensive and i do think that screenwriter stephen gaghan went a bit too far , portraying the yemeni people almost as stereotypical hollywood bad-guys .
